Tasker Configuration¶

Tasker stores in options in a standard .ini file.

The basic sections are: Tasker, Files, Plugin Management

Tasker Options¶

These options define the basic behavior of Tasker. The priority-z-last option only take effect if the tasks are sorted by priority.

Option Default Description
wrap-width 78 Default character width for wrap or shorten options
wrap-behavior wrap Options are wrap, shorten, or none
show-priority-z True Show anything with priority Z
priority-z-last True List anything with a priority Z after unprioritized tasks
hidden-extensions uid Extensions that should be hidden (see note)

Note

Each plugin can define its own hidden-extensions option.

File Options¶

These define where Tasker will look for the todo.txt and done.txt files.

Option Default
tasker-dir ‘tasker’ inside the operating system standard APPDATA folder
done-path %(tasker-dir)s/done.txt
task-path %(tasker-dir)s/todo.txt

Note

You can view these files in your operating system by using the poweruser feature. See PowerUser for details.

Plugin Management Options¶

These options are managed by the manager so there is no need to edit manually unless something has gone wrong.

These options are lists separated by ;; sequences.

Option Explanation
generic_plugins_to_load List of plugins to load
subcommand_plugins_to_load List of plugins to load
newcommand_plugins_to_load List of plugins to load

[SubCommand Plugin: Workflow]

directory = (application folder)pluginsworkflows hidden-extensions = wid,ws,wn

[NewCommand Plugin: Reports] public_methods = do_projects,do_contexts

[NewCommand Plugin: Pending] public_methods = do_after hide_pend_ext = true hidden-extensions = pid
